text: The 2015–16 Milwaukee Bucks season was the 48th season of the franchise in the National Basketball Association (NBA).2015-16 Milwaukee Bucks On December 12, 2015, the team ended the Golden State Warriors 28-game winning streak including their NBA record-setting 24–0 start. ==Draft picks== {| class="wikitable sortable sortable" ! style="" width="10%"| Round ! style="" width="10%"| Pick ! style="" width="20%"| Player ! style="" width="15%"| Position ! style="" width="15%"| Nationality ! style="" width="20%"| College |- style="text-align: center" | 1 || 17 || || SG || || UNLV |- style="text- align: center" | 2 || 46 || || G || || UCLA |} ==Roster== ==Game log== ===Preseason=== |- style="background:#fbb;" | 1 | October 6 | @ Chicago | | Rashad Vaughn (20) | Damien Inglis (9) | Jorge Gutiérrez (7) | United Center 21,199 | 0–1 |- style="background:#fbb;" | 2 | October 10 | Detroit | | Greg Monroe (18) | Greg Monroe (8) | Gutiérrez, Vásquez (3) | BMO Harris Bradley Center 7,350 | 0–2 |- style="background:#bfb;" | 3 | October 13 | @ Cleveland | | Monroe & Vaughn (19) | Greg Monroe (13) | O.
